SENT.plain: Three patients with pregnancy-induced pancytopenia also exhibited variable features of sideroblastic anemia and amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
Treatment with anti-thymocyte globulin proved highly effective in two cases and a spontaneous remission occurred in the third
This illness is distinct from the more commonly reported incidental association of pregnancy with classic aplastic anemia
Its differentiation from myelodysplasia is also emphasized
